subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 30, 2007

TOP STORIESThompson To Take First Step Toward '08 Run
Fred Thompson, a former Tennessee senator and "Law & Order" actor, will take a step toward a formal presidential candidacy
                        next week, several officials said. A "testing the waters" committee will allow him to begin raising money and hiring staff. More...Watch: Capitol Bob On Gore In '08
• Bush Names New World Bank Chief• Man With Rare TB: I Sneaked Back Into U.S.
                     					| Watch• Aggressive Hunt For Brits Captured In Iraq
                     					| WatchU.S."Horrendous" Scene As Mom Hangs Self, Kids
Alejandra Estrada broke into her sister's trailer because she wanted to know why she hadn't shown up at work. Inside, she
                        found Gilberta Estrada and Gilberta's four young daughters hanging in a closet from fabric nooses. Only the infant survived. More...Watch: Mom, Kids Found Hanging
• American Al Qaeda Member Threatens Attack• Cruise Ship Jumper Now Faces Sex Charges• Man With Rare TB: I Sneaked Back Into U.S.
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldParents Of Missing U.K. Toddler Meet Pope
The parents of a 4-year-old British girl who disappeared weeks ago in Portugal have met Pope Benedict in St. Peter's Square.
                        Kate and Gerry McCann say the greeting will "sustain" them in their search. They now plan a publicity tour of Europe.    More...Watch: Holding Out Hope For Madeleine
• Aggressive Hunt For Brits Captured In Iraq
                     					| Watch• Chavez Threatens Last Opposition Network• The State Of The Surge
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsBush Names New World Bank Chief
President Bush has selected former U.S. trade representative Robert Zoellick to be the next president of the World Bank. He
                        would succeed Paul Wolfowitz, who resigned amid a controversy involving a pay raise he arranged for his girlfriend. More...
• Thompson To Take First Step Toward '08 Run
                     					| Watch• Gore: Bush Leads "Assault On Reason"
                     					| Watch• Bush And Putin Plan Maine Summit• More StoriesHealthMan With Rare TB: I Sneaked Back Into U.S.
A man placed under the first government-ordered quarantine since 1963 because of a dangerous form of tuberculosis took one
                        trans-Atlantic flight for his wedding and honeymoon and another because he feared for his life, a newspaper reported. More...Watch: Do You Have TB?
• Repairing The Ravages Of War Wounds
                     					| Watch• Outrage Over Organ Donor Reality Show• Big 3 Ponder Pawning Health Care On Unions• More StoriesSciTechSexy Photo Vaults Teen To Unwanted Fame
A shot of star athlete Allison Stokke at a meet proliferated on the Web, much to her chagrin. On The Early Show,
                        an expert offered tips to help parents keep their kids from meeting the same fate. More...Watch: Unwanted Web Celebrity
• Whales May Be Heading Home
                     					| Watch• Microsoft Unveils Table-Shaped Computer• News Corp. Snaps Up Photobucket• More StoriesBusinessNews Corp. Snaps Up Photobucket
MySpace's parent, News Corp.'s Fox Interactive Media, agreed to acquire Photobucket Inc. just weeks after a public spat in
                        which MySpace partially blocked content from Photobucket. More...
• The Five Best Gifts For Dads And Grads• Bush Names New World Bank Chief• Northwest Attendants Approve Pay Cuts• More StoriesEntertainmentRosie Shoe Shops On First Day Off
In a video posted on her Web site titled "First Day Off," Rosie O'Donnell sits with her daughter in her lap and shoe shops
                        online. More...
• Larry Birkhead Sued By His Ex-Attorney
                     					| Watch• Lindsay Lohan Returns To Rehab
                     					| Watch• Barton Back To Work After Hospital Stay• More StoriesOpinionNew Hampshire, Join The Rest Of Us
Special contributor Lloyd Garver notes that the ruggedly-individualistic New England state is the only one that doesn't
                        require adults to wear seat belts.  More...

Prayers For Madeleine's ReturnCBS News RAW: Pope Benedict XVI comforted the parents of missing 4-year-old Madeleine McCann. They traveled to the
                                    Vatican to meet him, asking for prayers and her safe return.
